thread.title: Photos: 'Queer dance freakout' protests bathroom bill at Texas governor's mansion | Photos | Dallas News
thread.title_full: Photos: 'Queer dance freakout' protests bathroom bill at Texas governor's mansion | Photos | Dallas News

title: Photos: 'Queer dance freakout' protests bathroom bill at Texas governor's mansion | Photos | Dallas News

organizations.name: spillman/special contributor texas department of public safety troopers

text:
Get Unlimited Digital Access Your first month is less than a dollar. $0.99 for first 4 weeks Subscribe Now 
Members of a crowd gathered Thursday night got their grooves on for a cause while protesting the transgender bathroom bill and supporting LGBT rights outside the Texas governor's mansion in Austin. 
A Facebook page for the event organizers said the dance is aimed at "transphobic and homophobic laws Greg Abbott and Dan Patrick and their administration have got in the pipeline." 
Gov. Greg Abbott was not in Austin at the time. Fitness instructor Erica Nix leads some of the dancers that showed up to show their support of the LGBTQ community gathered for a dance party in front of the Governor's Mansion in Austin, Thursday, Feb. 23, 2017. The so-called "Queer Dance Freakout" was inspired by a similar event last month held outside Vice President Mike Pence's Washington, D.C. home. (Stephen Spillman/Special Contributor) Logan Ware gets some glitter from from Becca Hyatt during a dance party to show support of the LGBTQ community in front of the Governor's Mansion in Austin, Thursday, Feb. 23, 2017.
